description: From Latin lūstrālis, from lūstrum (“purificatory sacrifice”); compare French lustral. See lustrum.

examples: So the men change along my changeless stream,And change their faiths; but I yield all alikeSweet water for their drinking, sweet as wine,And pure sweet water for their lustral rites:For thirty generations of my cornOutlast a generation of my men,And thirty generations of my menOutlast a generation of their gods.

entries.meaning: Of or relating to a lustrum, or period of five years.
